verses.kjv: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
verses.web: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
verses.ct: Jesus and his disciples crossed the sea and arrived in the region of the Gadarenes.

verses.kjv: And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
verses.web: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.
verses.ct: The moment Jesus stepped out of the boat, a man with an unclean spirit came out from among the tombs to meet him.

verses.kjv: Who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:
verses.web: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains,
verses.ct: This man lived among the burial tombs, and no one could restrain him — not even with chains.

verses.kjv: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any man tame him.
verses.web: because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him.
verses.ct: People had tried many times to bind him with shackles and chains, but he snapped the chains apart and shattered the shackles. No one was strong enough to control him.

verses.kjv: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.
verses.web: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.
verses.ct: Day and night, without stopping, he wandered through the tombs and the hills, screaming and slashing himself with sharp stones.

verses.kjv: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,
verses.web: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,
verses.ct: When he spotted Jesus from a distance, he ran toward him and fell on his knees before him.

verses.kjv: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
verses.web: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don’t torment me.”
verses.ct: He screamed at the top of his voice, "What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you by God, don't torment me!"

verses.kjv: For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.
verses.web: For he said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
verses.ct: He said this because Jesus had commanded, "Come out of this man, you unclean spirit!"

verses.kjv: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.
verses.web: He asked him, “What is your name?” He said to him, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
verses.ct: Jesus asked him, "What is your name?" He answered, "My name is Legion, because there are many of us."

verses.kjv: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
verses.web: He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
verses.ct: The demons begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the region.

verses.kjv: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.
verses.web: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.
verses.ct: Nearby on the hillside, a large herd of pigs was feeding.

verses.kjv: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.
verses.web: All the demons begged him, saying, “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.”
verses.ct: The demons pleaded with him, "Send us into the pigs! Let us go into them."

verses.kjv: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.
verses.web: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea.
verses.ct: Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out of the man and entered the pigs. The entire herd — about 2,000 of them — stampeded down the steep bank into the sea and drowned.

verses.kjv: And they that fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.
verses.web: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.
verses.ct: The men tending the pigs ran off and spread the news throughout the town and the surrounding countryside. People came out to see what had happened.

verses.kjv: And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
verses.web: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.
verses.ct: When they reached Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons sitting there calmly, fully clothed, and completely in his right mind. This terrified them.

verses.kjv: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and also concerning the swine.
verses.web: Those who saw it declared to them what happened to him who was possessed by demons, and about the pigs.
verses.ct: The eyewitnesses described everything that had happened to the demon-possessed man and told them about the pigs.

verses.kjv: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.
verses.web: They began to beg him to depart from their region.
verses.ct: The people began begging Jesus to leave their region.

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.
verses.web: As he was entering into the boat, he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him.
verses.ct: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been freed from the demons begged to go with him.

verses.kjv: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.
verses.web: He didn’t allow him, but said to him, “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.”
verses.ct: But Jesus didn't let him. Instead he said, "Go home to your family and friends, and tell them everything the Lord has done for you and how he had mercy on you."

verses.kjv: And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all men did marvel.
verses.web: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.
verses.ct: So the man went away and began telling everyone throughout the Decapolis region what Jesus had done for him. Everyone who heard it was amazed.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.
verses.web: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.
verses.ct: After Jesus crossed back to the other side by boat, a huge crowd gathered around him along the shore.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,
verses.web: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet,
verses.ct: A synagogue leader named Jairus arrived, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.

verses.kjv: And besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: I pray thee, come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.
verses.web: and begged him much, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.”
verses.ct: He pleaded desperately, "My little daughter is dying. Please come and place your hands on her so she'll be healed and live."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.
verses.web: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.
verses.ct: Jesus went with him, and a massive crowd followed, pressing in on him from every side.

verses.kjv: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,
verses.web: A certain woman, who had a discharge of blood for twelve years,
verses.ct: In the crowd was a woman who had been suffering from bleeding for 12 years.

verses.kjv: And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,
verses.web: and had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse,
verses.ct: She had endured painful treatments from doctor after doctor and had spent every penny she had, but nothing helped. In fact, she only got worse.

verses.kjv: When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.
verses.web: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.
verses.ct: She had heard about Jesus, so she pushed through the crowd behind him and touched his clothes.

verses.kjv: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.
verses.web: For she said, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”
verses.ct: She had told herself, "If I can just touch his clothes, I'll be healed."

verses.kjv: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague.
verses.web: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
verses.ct: Instantly the bleeding stopped, and she could feel in her body that she was healed of her affliction.

verses.kjv: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?
verses.web: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
verses.ct: At that same moment, Jesus sensed that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, "Who touched my clothes?"

verses.kjv: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?
verses.web: His disciples said to him, “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’ ”
verses.ct: His disciples said, "You see this crowd crushing against you from every direction, and you're asking, 'Who touched me?'"

verses.kjv: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
verses.web: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.
verses.ct: But Jesus kept looking around to find the person who had done it.

verses.kjv: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
verses.web: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
verses.ct: The woman, shaking with fear and knowing what had happened to her, came forward, fell at his feet, and told him the whole truth.

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.
verses.web: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to her, "Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be free from your suffering."

verses.kjv: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
verses.web: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”
verses.ct: While Jesus was still speaking, some people arrived from Jairus's house with the news: "Your daughter is dead. There's no reason to bother the Teacher anymore."

verses.kjv: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.
verses.web: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Don’t be afraid, only believe.”
verses.ct: But Jesus overheard what they said and immediately told Jairus, "Don't be afraid. Just believe."

verses.kjv: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
verses.web: He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.
verses.ct: He didn't let anyone come with him except Peter, James, and James's brother John.

verses.kjv: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.
verses.web: He came to the synagogue ruler’s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.
verses.ct: When they arrived at Jairus's house, Jesus found chaos — people weeping and wailing loudly.

verses.kjv: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.web: When he had entered in, he said to them, “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”
verses.ct: He went inside and said to them, "Why all this commotion and crying? The child isn't dead — she's sleeping."

verses.kjv: And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.
verses.web: They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.
verses.ct: They laughed at him. But he sent them all outside, then took the girl's father and mother and his 3 disciples into the room where the child was lying.

verses.kjv: And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.
verses.web: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha cumi!” which means, being interpreted, “Girl, I tell you, get up!”
verses.ct: He took the girl by the hand and said, "Talitha cumi!" — which means, "Little girl, I'm telling you, get up!"

verses.kjv: And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was of the age of twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.
verses.web: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.
verses.ct: Immediately the girl stood up and began walking around. She was 12 years old. Everyone there was completely astonished.

verses.kjv: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.
verses.web: He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.
verses.ct: Jesus gave them strict orders not to tell anyone about this, and then told them to give her something to eat.
